adrFormatAddress: 1239 1st Ave., New York, NY 10065, USA

editorialSummary.text: Counter-serve deli with limited seating offering sandwiches, salads & pastas, plus baked goods.

originalText.text:
I was pretty curious about this place for years now. The blood center I go to often is right nearby. Anyway, I decided to finally give this place a chance. When I went in, there were so many food options that I actually took quite some time to decide. This place can easily cater to meat and veggie lovers alike. I had the hamburger, chicken fingers, and french fries and they tasted pretty good to me.

Their beverages are plentiful too in which they have coffee which I was told that it was good. True to their word, it was. The employees were really cool and even helped me out by giving me a bag for the goodies I was carrying that day. I felt really valued each time so I will say give this place a chance to impress you. To this day, I have no regrets coming here.

originalText.text: Such a fun experience! My friend and I went one morning when I visited NY and we had a great time here. I ordered a salad and she had an omelette and we both loved our food. The staff were very friendly and quickly serviced us. The food here lives up to the name as it is very fresh! You can dine in or order delivery/takeout. They have plenty of delicious options, I promise you will enjoy your food.

The staff were very friendly and quickly serviced us. The food here lives up to the name as it is very fresh! You can dine in or order delivery/takeout. They have plenty of delicious options, I promise you will enjoy your food.

originalText.text: Turkey bacon, egg, and cheese was good, certainly not a bad option. Just felt slightly pricey for what we got versus other options in the area and the (T)BEC offerings they have. Totally fine, just not a standout.

text.text: Turkey bacon, egg, and cheese was good, certainly not a bad option. Just felt slightly pricey for what we got versus other options in the area and the (T)BEC offerings they have. Totally fine, just not a standout.

originalText.text: Great restaurant with a lot of options, including healthy ones! I opted for the salad bar around lunchtime. The salad bar was nice and clean, and they had many options to put in your salad and all of the ingredients were fresh and vibrant! I built my own salad and it came up to around $10, which is a good price. The workers were very nice. Overall, amazing and definitely will be returning soon.

text.text: Great restaurant with a lot of options, including healthy ones! I opted for the salad bar around lunchtime. The salad bar was nice and clean, and they had many options to put in your salad and all of the ingredients were fresh and vibrant! I built my own salad and it came up to around $10, which is a good price. The workers were very nice. Overall, amazing and definitely will be returning soon.

originalText.text:
Welcoming smiles. Attention to questions. Understanding the options. Patient with hard to make up mind grandpa and granddaughter. Asking us ,making sure we order what we want....and clean tables, floors and one person at a time bathroom. Foam soap, hot air dryer and plenty of toilet paper.
Looking out the floor to ceiling windows on this happy corner,  E. 67th and 1st Ave. inspires dreaming,  writing,  planning the day.....and with the magic of St. Catherine's Park/Playground across the street, Cafe Fresco can be a favorite before and after outdoor fun.
And the welcome respect starts at the door, free of the sign which to me means "Not Nice"---"Restroom for customers onl."
